018package org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc.umlgraph;
019
020import static java.util.Objects.isNull;
021import static java.util.Objects.nonNull;
022import static java.util.stream.Collectors.toList;
023import static javax.lang.model.element.ElementKind.CLASS;
024import static javax.lang.model.element.ElementKind.INTERFACE;
025import static javax.lang.model.element.Modifier.ABSTRACT;
026import static javax.lang.model.type.TypeKind.NONE;
027import static org.apiguardian.api.API.Status.INTERNAL;
028import static org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc.internal.ToolKit.requireNonNullArgument;
029import static org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc.umlgraph.Stereotype.ANNOTATION;
030import static org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc.umlgraph.Stereotype.ENUM;
031import static org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc.umlgraph.Stereotype.ERROR;
032import static org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc.umlgraph.Stereotype.EXCEPTION;
033import static org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc.umlgraph.Stereotype.TYPE;
034
035import javax.lang.model.element.Element;
036import javax.lang.model.element.ExecutableElement;
037import javax.lang.model.element.Name;
038import javax.lang.model.element.NestingKind;
039import javax.lang.model.element.TypeElement;
040import javax.lang.model.element.TypeParameterElement;
041import javax.lang.model.element.VariableElement;
042import javax.lang.model.type.TypeMirror;
043import javax.lang.model.util.Types;
044import java.util.EnumSet;
045import java.util.HashSet;
046import java.util.List;
047import java.util.Set;
048
049import org.apiguardian.api.API;
050import org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc.internal.ToolKit;
051import org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc.internal.foundation.annotation.ClassVersion;
052
053/**
054 *  The wrapper for a
055 *  {@link TypeElement}
056 *  instance, enhanced by information needed for the creation of the UML graph.
057 *
058 *  @author Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
059 *  @version $Id: UMLTypeElement.java 976 2022-01-06 11:39:58Z tquadrat $
060 *  @since 0.0.5
061 */
062@ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: UMLTypeElement.java 976 2022-01-06 11:39:58Z tquadrat $" )
063@API( status = INTERNAL, since = "0.0.5")
064public final class UMLTypeElement extends UMLElement implements TypeElement
065{
066        /*-----------*\
067    ====** Constants **========================================================
068        \*-----------*/
069    /**
070     *  An empty array of {@code UMLTypeElement} objects.
071     */
072    public static final UMLTypeElement [] EMPTY_UMLTypeElement_ARRAY = new UMLTypeElement [0];
073
074        /*------------*\
075    ====** Attributes **=======================================================
076        \*------------*/
077    /**
078     *  The types that extend this class or implements this interface.
079     */
080    private final Set<UMLTypeElement> m_ChildTypes = new HashSet<>();
081
082    /**
083     *  Flag that indicates whether this type element is included somehow in
084     *  the output of this run of JavaDoc.
085     */
086    private final boolean m_IsIncludedInOutput;
087
088    /**
089     *  The type utilities that are used by this type element to configure the
090     *  output.
091     */
092    private final Types m_TypeUtils;
093
094    /**
095     *  The wrapped type element.
096     */
097    private final TypeElement m_Wrapped;
098
099        /*--------------*\
100    ====** Constructors **=====================================================
101        \*--------------*/
102    /**
103     *  Creates a new {@code UMLTypeElement} instance.
104     *
105     *  @param  element The wrapped type element.
106     *  @param  isIncluded  {@code true} if this type element is included
107     *      somehow in the output of this run of JavaDoc, {@code false}
108     *      otherwise.
109     *  @param  typeUtils   The type utilities.
110     */
111    public UMLTypeElement( final TypeElement element, final boolean isIncluded, final Types typeUtils )
112    {
113        super( element );
114        m_Wrapped = element; // Null check is done by super constructor.
115        m_IsIncludedInOutput = isIncluded;
116        m_TypeUtils = requireNonNullArgument( typeUtils, "typeUtils" );
117    }   //  UMLTypeElement()
118
119        /*---------*\
120    ====** Methods **==========================================================
121        \*---------*/
122    /**
123     *  Adds a type that extends or implements this one.
124     *
125     *  @param  child   The
126     *      {@link UMLTypeElement}
127     *      instance for the child type.
128     */
129    public final void addChildType( final UMLTypeElement child ) { m_ChildTypes.add( requireNonNullArgument( child, "child" ) ); }
130
131    /**
132     *  Creates the SVG symbol that represents this type element for the UML
133     *  diagram.
134     *
135     *  @param  layout    The instance of
136     *      {@link UMLGraphLayout}
137     *      that is used to render the document that finally contains the
138     *      {@link org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc.internal.foundation.svg.SVGSymbol}
139     *      instance that is created by this method.
140     *  @param  details The level of detail to show:<ul>
141     *      <li>0: no details, only class name and package name; for an enum
142     *      also the enum constants</li>
143     *      <li>1: only elements should be shown that are relevant for the
144     *      API</li>
145     *      <li>2: all elements should be shown.</li></ul>
146     *  @param  isFocusClass    {@code true} if this class is the focus
147     *      class of the graph.
148     *  @return The SVG symbol instance that represents the UML diagram for
149     *      this class.
150     */
151    public final TypeSymbol createSymbol( final UMLGraphLayout layout, final int details, final boolean isFocusClass )
152    {
153        //---* Analyse the arguments *-----------------------------------------
154        final var apiOnly = (details <= 1) || !m_IsIncludedInOutput;
155
156        //---* Render the class *----------------------------------------------
157        final var retValue = new TypeSymbol( layout.getDocument(), this, isFocusClass, apiOnly, m_IsIncludedInOutput );
158
159        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
160        return retValue;
161    }   //  createSymbol()
162
163    /**
164     *  Determines the stereotypes for this UML class doc. It will be inferred
165     *  from the type of the class. The stereotype
166     *  {@linkplain Stereotype#INTERFACE Â«InterfaceÂ»}
167     *  is used for an interface,
168     *  {@linkplain Stereotype#ENUM Â«EnumÂ»}
169     *  for an {@code enum} type, and
170     *  {@linkplain Stereotype#ANNOTATION Â«AnnotationÂ»}
171     *  for an annotation.<br>
172     *  <br>A <i>regular</i> class that is derived from
173     *  {@link Error}
174     *  will have the stereotype
175     *  {@linkplain Stereotype#ERROR Â«ErrorÂ»},
176     *  or
177     *  {@linkplain Stereotype#EXCEPTION Â«ExceptionÂ»}
178     *  if derived from
179     *  {@link Exception}.<br>
180     *  <br>An abstract class will have the stereotype
181     *  {@linkplain Stereotype#TYPE Â«TypeÂ»},
182     *  a class with only static methods (or no methods at all) the stereotype
183     *  {@linkplain Stereotype#UTILITY Â«UtilityÂ»}.<br>
184     *  <br>If none of the conditions above will fit, we have a simple class
185     *  without a particular stereotype.
186     *
187     *  @return The list of stereotypes defined for this UML type element; it
188     *      may be empty, but will never be {@code null}.
189     */
190    final String [] determineStereotypes()
191    {
192        //---* Determine the stereotype *----------------------------------
193        final Set<Stereotype> stereotype = EnumSet.noneOf( Stereotype.class );
194        KindSwitch:
195        switch( m_Wrapped.getKind() )
196        {
197            case ANNOTATION_TYPE -> stereotype.add( ANNOTATION );
198            case ENUM -> stereotype.add( ENUM );
199            case INTERFACE -> stereotype.add( Stereotype.INTERFACE );
200            //$CASES-OMITTED$
201            default ->
202            {
203                stereotype.add( Stereotype.CLASS );
204                if( getModifiers().contains( ABSTRACT ) )
205                {
206                    stereotype.add( TYPE );
207                }
208                else
209                {
210                    var superclass = getSuperclass();
211                    Element element;
212                    while( !(isNull( superclass ) || (superclass.getKind() == NONE)) )
213                    {
214                        if( "java.lang.Exception".equals( superclass.toString() ) )
215                        {
216                            stereotype.add( EXCEPTION );
217                            //noinspection AssignmentToNull
218                            superclass = null;
219                            continue;
220                        }
221
222                        if( "java.lang.Error".equals( superclass.toString() ) )
223                        {
224                            stereotype.add( ERROR );
225                            //noinspection AssignmentToNull
226                            superclass = null;
227                            continue;
228                        }
229
230                        element = m_TypeUtils.asElement( superclass );
231                        if( nonNull( element ) )
232                        {
233                            superclass = ((TypeElement) element).getSuperclass();
234                        }
235                        else
236                        {
237                            //noinspection AssignmentToNull
238                            superclass = null;
239                        }
240                    }
241                }
242            }
243        }   //  KindSwitch:
244
245        final var retValue = stereotype.stream()
246            .map( Stereotype::toString )
247            .filter( ToolKit::isNotEmpty )
248            .toArray( String []::new );
249
250        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
251        return retValue;
252    }   //  determineStereotypes()
253
254    /**
255     *  {@inheritDoc}
256     */
257    @SuppressWarnings( "TypeMayBeWeakened" )
258    @Override
259    public final boolean equals( final Object obj )
260    {
261        var retValue = this == obj;
262        if( !retValue && (obj instanceof UMLTypeElement other ) )
263        {
264            retValue = getQualifiedName().equals( other.getQualifiedName() );
265        }
266
267        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
268        return retValue;
269    }   //  equals()
270
271    /**
272     *  Returns a list with the attributes for this type. Enum constants will
273     *  be ignored.
274     *
275     *  @param  apiOnly Flag that indicates that only attributes that are
276     *      relevant for the API will be returned.
277     *  @return The attributes; the list can be empty if the type is an
278     *      interface or there is no relevant field.
279     */
280    final List<UMLVariableElement> getAttributes( final boolean apiOnly )
281    {
282        final var retValue = getEnclosedElements().stream()
283            .filter( UMLElement::isAttribute )
284            .filter( e -> !apiOnly || isAPI( e ) )
285            .map( e -> (VariableElement) e )
286            .map( UMLVariableElement::new )
287            .collect( toList() );
288
289        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
290        return retValue;
291    }   //  getAttributes()
292
293    /**
294     *  Returns the children of this type. These are the types that implements
295     *  or extends it.
296     *
297     *  @return The children.
298     *
299     *  @see #addChildType(UMLTypeElement)
300     */
301    public final UMLTypeElement [] getChildTypes() { return m_ChildTypes.toArray( EMPTY_UMLTypeElement_ARRAY ); }
302
303    /**
304     *  Returns a list with the constructors for this type.
305     *
306     *  @param  apiOnly Flag that indicates that only constructors that are
307     *      relevant for the API will be returned.
308     *  @return The constructors; the list can be empty if the type is an
309     *      interface or there is no relevant constructor.
310     */
311    public final List<UMLConstructorElement> getConstructors( final boolean apiOnly )
312    {
313        final var retValue = getEnclosedElements().stream()
314            .filter( UMLElement::isConstructor )
315            .filter( e -> !apiOnly || isAPI( e ) )
316            .map( e -> (ExecutableElement) e )
317            .map( UMLConstructorElement::new )
318            .collect( toList() );
319
320        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
321        return retValue;
322    }   //  getConstructors()
323
324    /**
325     *  {@inheritDoc}
326     */
327    @Override
328    public final List<? extends TypeMirror> getInterfaces() { return m_Wrapped.getInterfaces(); }
329
330    /**
331     *  Returns a list with the methods for this type.
332     *
333     *  @param  apiOnly Flag that indicates that only methods that are
334     *      relevant for the API will be returned.
335     *  @return The methods; the list can be empty if there is no relevant
336     *      method.
337     */
338    public final List<UMLMethodElement> getMethods( final boolean apiOnly )
339    {
340        final var retValue = getEnclosedElements().stream()
341            .filter( UMLElement::isMethod )
342            .filter( e -> !apiOnly || isAPI( e ) )
343            .map( e -> (ExecutableElement) e )
344            .map( UMLMethodElement::new )
345            .collect( toList() );
346
347        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
348        return retValue;
349    }   //  getMethods()
350
351    /**
352     *  {@inheritDoc}
353     */
354    @Override
355    public final NestingKind getNestingKind() { return m_Wrapped.getNestingKind(); }
356
357    /**
358     *  {@inheritDoc}
359     */
360    @Override
361    public final Name getQualifiedName() { return m_Wrapped.getQualifiedName(); }
362
363    /**
364     *  {@inheritDoc}
365     */
366    @Override
367    public final TypeMirror getSuperclass() { return m_Wrapped.getSuperclass(); }
368
369    /**
370     *  {@inheritDoc}
371     */
372    @Override
373    public final List<? extends TypeParameterElement> getTypeParameters() { return m_Wrapped.getTypeParameters(); }
374
375    /**
376     *  {@inheritDoc}
377     */
378    @Override
379    public final int hashCode() { return getQualifiedName().toString().hashCode(); }
380
381    /**
382     *  Returns {@code true} if this type is abstract, either an abstract class
383     *  or an interface.
384     *
385     *  @return {@code true} if this type is abstract.
386     */
387    public final boolean isAbstract() { return isInterface() || getModifiers().contains( ABSTRACT ); }
388
389    /**
390     *  Returns {@code true} if this type element represents a class. Different
391     *  from
392     *  {@link javax.lang.model.element.ElementKind#isClass()},
393     *  this method will return {@code false} if this type element is an
394     *  {@code enum}.
395     *
396     *  @return {@code true} if this type element represents a class.
397     */
398    public final boolean isClass() { return getKind() == CLASS; }
399
400    /**
401     *  Returns {@code true} if this type represents an interface. Different
402     *  from
403     *  {@link javax.lang.model.element.ElementKind#isInterface()},
404     *  this method will return {@code false} if this type element is an
405     *  {@code annotation}.
406     *
407     *  @return {@code true} if this type represents an interface.
408     */
409    public final boolean isInterface() { return getKind() == INTERFACE; }
410}
411//  class UMLTypeElement
412
413/*
414 *  End of File
